Text: [We see a gloomy sorcerer's castle, with crows flying around it. The camera flies around several of its rooms showing various ingenious magical devices and then descends into the basement, where we see the sorcerer Zarok himself. His skin is wrinkled, insects are running around - everything indicates that we have a living corpse before us. Zarok flips through the book of spells, finds the right one, takes his staff and goes to the hill next to the city. Under the rumble of thunder, Zarok swings his staff and released a wave of green energy. Next, he enters the city itself. He lifts his staff and releases the rays of green energy that hit the inhabitants of the city, stealing their souls and turning them into zombies. Stolen souls suck in Zarok's staff. Then the sorcerer goes to the cemetery, emitting a green glow. Above the gates of the cemetery, there is a wrought-iron plate called "Fortesque". Under the influence of green light, the trees become evil monsters and the corpses rise from the graves. But Zarok overlooks one thing - having awakened the dead, he inadvertently woke up his sworn enemy. The green glow strikes him like lightning and, seeing a glimpse of his past life, Sir Daniel Fortesque rise up from the grave.]

Speaker: Gargoyle #1
Text: It has risen again - Sir Daniel Fortesque. See? The hero of Gallowmere who fell at the first charge! The fog of war and the shrouds of time conspired to turn the arrow fodder into the savior of the day. But we know better…

Speaker: Daniel
Text: I’ll show you!

Speaker: Gargoyle #2
Text: Let it alone! Fate has given it a second chance, and a chance to forget the ignoble truth, a chance to defeat Zarok and live up to the legend. We hopes it does well.
[The game starts. Daniel approaches several books on pedestals near the entrance to his mausoleum.]

Speaker: Book #1
Text: When you're ready to leave this crypt you’ll find an exit to the end of the hall. To unlock the gates you must find a Rune Stone and place it in the ornate hand set next to the doorway.

Speaker: Book #2
Text: You must be out of shape after 100 years lying on your back. Use the crypt to get to grips with your new lease of life.

Speaker: Book #3
Text: During your travels through the world of Gallowmere you will collect many items, To look at your inventory, press the SELECT button on the Controller.

Speaker: Book #4
Text: To do a power attack, press and hold the SQUARE button on the Controller for a second or two and then release it.

Speaker: Book #5
Text: Feel free to have a paddle in the water, but don't be tempted to go for a swim, buoyancy can be a problem for those of a dead disposition.
[Dan picks up a copper shield and a bag of coins after which he reads another book.]

Speaker: Book #5
Text: Any Treasure that you find will go into your coin score, displayed in the top right of your
[Dan picks up Throwing Daggers and Life Bottle, going upstairs and read the last book.]

Speaker: Book #6
Text: Track down Zarok by retracing his diabolical odyssey through Gallowmere, you spot the exits from an area by looking out for his stinking trail of magic slime.
[Leaving his crypt, Dan goes to the world map and from there he heads to The Graveyard.]
[Near the entrance Dan finds a book.]

Speaker: Book #1
Text: Welcome back to your beloved Gallowmere. The stinking dead have risen up to dance with the lifeless living, and they want to do it over your dead body.
[Dan goes on fighting with zombies rising from the graves. At the rejuvenation fountain, he finds a couple of books.]

Speaker: Book #2
Text: Don't let zombies get you down. Tend those wounds by stepping into this fountain of rejuvenation.

Speaker: Book #3
Text: Remember, nothing remains hidden under the gaze of an angel.
[Opening the passage to the Chalice, Dan finds a book explaining what it is and how to get it.]

Speaker: Book #4
Text: The object here is the Chalice. Every time you dispatch an enemy the Chalice fills a little more. Once the Chalice is full it is yours to collect and you will be worthy of visiting the sacred Hall of Heroes to claim a prize! There is a Chalice to be found in every region of Gallowmere. They are all hidden or well guarded – only a true here will collect the full set.
[Dan approaching a massive arc door.]

Speaker: Book #5
Text: The living world lies beyond these Skull Gates. The Master of the Hilltop Mausoleum, the Stained Glass Demon has Possession of the Skull Key.
[Dan kills all the zombies in The Graveyard and comes to the exit from the level. Next to it he finds a gargoyle.]

Speaker: Gargoyle
Text: Tread softly – Zarok awaits beyond these Gates! The master meets with the Demon from the Mausoleum, hatching plots of purest evil. Forgotten nobodies would be wise to make themselves scarce!

Speaker: Gargoyle
Text: Welcome to The Hall of Heroes, where the bravest warriors from history spend eternity, feasting, singing and arm wrestling! If they think you are worthy enough you may be able to persuade them to give you a new weapon.
[Dan enters a large hall with many statues and a huge table in the center. Next to him he finds a book.]

Speaker: Book #1
Text: To pay homage to the Heroes: stand in front of their designated statues and await spiritual guidance.
[Dan comes to the statue of a young man with a crossbow that glows green.]

Speaker: Canny Tim
Text: Captain Fortesque! It’s me, Canny Tim. Does the battle go well?

Speaker: Daniel
Text: Not too good!

Speaker: Canny Tim
Text: How I wish I could fight at you side again, sir. But hold, you could take my crossbow, it’s got rapid fire and you can ricochet the darts off walls to shoot around corners. I used it at the Battle of Gallowmere after you were slain. I shot Zarok’s champion Lord Kardok – a clean kill, through the eye at some 1000 yards…

Speaker: Daniel
Text: Get on with it!
[Dan accepts the gift.]

Speaker: Canny Tim
Text: Not that there’s anything clever about shooting someone in the eye, sir.

Speaker: Daniel
Text: Watch it!

Speaker: Canny Tim
Text: Duh! G-goobye, sir.
[Dan takes Crossbow and goes to the second floor.]

Speaker: Book #2
Text: Only when you are truly worthy as a Hero will you be able to ascend to the higher level of this Hall. When you have paid homage to all of the Heroes in the lower Hall the ghostly stairs will then become solid.
[Dan leaves The Hall of Heroes and goes to Cemetery Hill.]
[The Cemetery Hill meets us with a camera flying around the entire level and a small cutscene at the end. Zarok leaves the temple and begins to grumble.]

Speaker: Zarok
Text: So, even from the shackles of death my old enemy pursues me! You’re too late, Fortesque – already my army has risen from the grave! You will never leave this necropolis… Ha, ha, ha!
[He waves his staff and on the top of the hill where he stands, two stone statues appear spitting with stones.]
[Dan stands near the entrance to the level.]

Speaker: Book #1
Text: Some obstructions can be smashed down with clubs and certain other weapons, try experimenting.
[He finds a club.]

Speaker: Book #2
Text: The club is a crude, but effective weapon. Bash it! Burn with it! But beware, one bash too many and it will break.
[Dan goes to the cave, littered with a boulder.]

Speaker: Book #3
Text: Of great archaeological interest. Destroy the boulder and plunder the valuable treasures within.
[Dan destroys the boulder and enter the cave. He finds a gargoyle.]

Speaker: Gargoyle
Text: Cough! Splutter! Aaah – fresh air! We hates these dark old caves and their filthy stench of old witches. A coven of the warty old hags lived here once – unholy fires burning all night while they brewed up unspeakable muck in their cauldrons. They moved on years back but the smell still makes our eyes sting.
[Inside the cave, Dan encounters several zombies and finds a secret location hidden behind a bookcase.]

Speaker: Book #4
Text: A GUIDE TO COVENS
[Dan climbs to the top of the hill, evading falling stones from it.]

Speaker: Stone Statues
Text: We have failed the Master! We give our lives!
[At the top of the hill Dan finds the last book.]

Speaker: Book #5
Text: The adventurer would be wise to be thorough in the exploration of an area. Hidden locations reap great rewards.
[Dan leaves Cemetery Hill and goes to The Hall of Heroes.]

Speaker: Gargoyle
Text: Back from the battles so soon? It must think it is a hero by now but only a true hero is worthy of a place in The Hall of Heroes. See the ghostly statue of your fraudster self? When it is has turned solid a true hero you will be.
[Dan goes to Canny Tim again.]

Speaker: Canny Tim
Text: Hurrah, I knew it would take more than an army of evil dead to throw your stride, sir. Oh, have something that may help you on your quest, captain, I give it to you freely, though I have no idea what it is.
[Dan accepts the gift and take Life Bottle, after which he leaves The Hall of Heroes and go to The Hilltop Mausoleum.]
[After Dan enters the mausoleum, a gate opens before him.]

Speaker: Book #1
Text: You are entering a house of pain! Rumors abound of evil doings in the secret catacombs below this very Hall.
[He descends into the catacombs.]

Speaker: Book #2
Text: Watch out for sticky-fingered imps. These thieves strip you down to your armored undies.
[Getting out of the catacombs, Dan finds a staircase to the first floor.]

Speaker: Book #3
Text: The Stained Glass Demon is the Master of the Mausoleum. His wretched soul lies preserved inside frozen glass heart. Shrouded in a veil of darkness beneath the Mausoleum you find this pre-frozen menace.
[Near the central hall of the mausoleum, he enters a room in which he sees a gigantic ghost playing on the organ.]

Speaker: Book #4
Text: The would be Phantom of the Opera longs to play new tune, but he seems doomed to repeat the same chords of despair over and over.

[Dan warms up the heart of the demon and finds a music sheet for the ghost. After giving it to him, the ghost plays a new melody, laughs and disappears. Opens the passage to a secret room with treasures. Dan returns to the central hall of the mausoleum and fights The Stained Glass Demon.]

Speaker: Message
Text: The Demon’s heart is his only vulnerable point!
[The Demon is defeated and he falls theatrically and splits into pieces. Dan gets the Skull Key. After that the level just ends and Dan goes to The Hall of Heroes.]

Speaker: Gargoyle
Text: It’s The Hall of Heroes shopping mall! Bargain hunters should check out the ground floor. Well to do shoppers should check out the upper floor – that's where it’s at!
[Dan comes to the statue of a man with a huge hammer.]

Speaker: Man with Hammer
Text: Ahh Fortesque! What’s this I hear about that arch cad Zarok still being alive – thought you killed the fella!

Speaker: Daniel
Text: No, no…

Speaker: Man with Hammer
Text: Never mind, you old war-horse, better show ‘im what’s what, eh? I expect Johnny Zombie’s a bit more of a handful than you remember – how are you doing for weapons?

Speaker: Daniel
Text: Not too good!

Speaker: Man with Hammer
Text: Here, take my WarHammer, it’ll smash anything and it won’t fall apart like a club – I only ever get to use it cracking walnuts around this place.

Speaker: Daniel
Text: Great!
[Dan accepts the gift.]

Speaker: Man with Hammer
Text: Nonsense, Fortesque I won’t take no for an answer. Knock a few heads for old Stanyer Iron Hewer, eh?
[Dan takes the Hammer and leaves The Hall of Heroes.]
[Dan returns to the Graveyard to use the Skull Key. Jumping off the ruined bridge on the coffin, he finds a secret location.]

Speaker: Book #1
Text: Who's a clever skeleton then? Remember that there are many more secret areas like this throughout the land of Gallowmere some offering more than just treasure!
[At the top of the hill, Dan finds a book.]

Speaker: Book #2
Text: Want to be faster on your feet? Want to be able to bash through walls by charging into them? All you have to do is defeat the evil Guardians of the Graveyard and gain this new ability! You will never know why you left the grave without it!
[Solving the riddle with the bridge, Dan gets in a large fenced area.]

Speaker: Message
Text: Prepare to battle the Guardians of the Graveyard…
[Dan defeats two ghost wolf, that guards the exit from the cemetery.]

Speaker: Message
Text: The evil Guardians of the Graveyard have been vanquished! You have claimed the “Daring Dash” ability, use it well Sir Dan.
[At the exit Dan speaks with a gargoyle.]

Speaker: Gargoyle
Text: All changed outside the Necropolis, path go this way, path go that way... Nasty painful death waits around every turn and over every hill. Bon Voyage!

Speaker: Stanyer Iron Hewer
Text: Bravo Fortesque, some of the other chaps wagered Zarok would be using your rib cage as a toast rack by now. But I knew you'd pull through. Here, I have a little extra something here I can give you. Could help the old quest, do you want it?

Speaker: Daniel
Text: Yes please!
[Dan accepts the gift. It’s two chests of gold. Dan takes it and leaves The Hall of Heroes.]
[Dan walks into the cornfield, jumping over the gate. As he walks in the background, we see an eerie laughing scarecrow.]

Speaker: Book #1
Text: The scarecrows are almost unstoppable so don’t be a hero! Try trapping them while you make you escape.

Speaker: Book #2
Text: Beware of mischief makers in metal machines! Who knows what dark sorcery brings their metal limbs to life! It would be good to see the back of such menaces!

Speaker: Book #3
Text: Kul Katura the Serpent Lord yearns to fight along side you but has been captured by Zarok and sealed within a chest. Free this mighty spirit and earn a powerful ally!

Speaker: Book #4
Text: Death waits in the cornfield. Pick your route carefully and do not linger in the corn.

Speaker: Book #5
Text: These fields are home to many mad machines, yet the most bizarre of them is housed within this barn.

Speaker: Book #6
Text: The corn cutting machine is missing a part. A cog fell off this miracle of modern agriculture and it hasn’t worked since.
[Near the exit Dan finds a gargoyle.]

Speaker: Gargoyle
Text: Pumpkin Gorge dead ahead, the nursery to Gallowmere’s favorite side dish. Step inside and understand the true horror of fruit gone bad!

Speaker: Man
Text: Fortesque, you jawless arrow magnet – what are you doing back here?

Speaker: Daniel
Text: Huh… what… me?

Speaker: Man
Text: What? Call me MISTER Woden the Mighty! How I pity the people of Gallowmere – that their fate should once again be in the hands of chump like you! Still, I suppose it’s not fair to take it out on them – take my sword – and do try not to stab yourself in the foot. You know, I’ve always had my doubts about you, Fortesque – you’re just not carved from hero material…

Speaker: Daniel
Text: I’ll show you!
[Dan accepts the gift and leave The Hall of Heroes.]
[Our hero finds a huge pumpkin farm. He breaks through thickets, weeding out evil plants.]

Speaker: Book #1
Text: Up and down these magical mushrooms go! They will take you higher and higher but be careful not to fall and sink without a trace.
[Before leaving the garden, Dan talks to the gargoyle.]

Speaker: Gargoyle
Text: All bow down before the master of the vegetable patch, the prize-winning plant who can summon an army of cabbage with a wave of his noble tendril. He’s delicious, he nutritious, he’s Zarok’s secret recipe – he’s the Pumpkin King!

Speaker: Gargoyle
Text: Gaining allies in The Hall of Heroes is the way forward! Hack! Choppety chop! Off with a few zombies heads and it thinks it can redeem itself in battle! You still have a long way to go to rank as the best!

Speaker: Woden the Mighty
Text: By God, Fortesque, you must be the luckiest corpse ever walk the face of the Earth! I have something here I can lend to you – take it or leave it but remember I’m only doing this for the sake of Gallowmere’s doomed population and not for you, you gangly buffoon…
[Dan accepts the gift and gets two chests of gold.]
[Dan gets to a wide area, in the center of which he finds a monstrous pumpkin.]

Speaker: Message
Text: The King Pumpkin sleeps – if you want an audience with this regal plant you should mash all of his pod sacks!

Speaker: Book #1
Text: It is rumored that the Pumpkin Witch is in possession of a much sought after Dragon Gem. If you have a Witch Talisman you could summon this kindly Witch.
[Dan uses the talisman over the cauldron and calls on the Pumpkin Witch.]

Speaker: Pumpkin Witch
Text: Greetings kind sir. I am the Pumpkin Witch. I’m a mother to those pumpkins – I gave them all the love and care a young fruit could ever ask for. From the moment they first push a shoot above the soil, right up until their heads are cut off and eaten – and look, see how they repay me! Running around and causing mischief! That nasty old big Pumpkin is a bad influence on the young seedlings, if you teach him a lesson in manners I might gave you a nice present!
[Once all the pods are destroyed, the Pumpkin King awakens. Our hero turns it into a porridge and returns to Pumpkin Witch.]

Speaker: Pumpkin Witch
Text: A most edifying spectacle sir: man and vegetable in a magnificent duel to the death. Ooh, I’ve come over all of a doodah. Here, have this lovely Dragon Gem as your reward. Ohh, lovely majestic creatures Dragons are…

Speaker: African woman with Spear
Text: Dan, Dan, Dan. Tell me, what’s a warrior queen got to do to meet someone like you?

Speaker: Daniel
Text: Huh… what… me?

Speaker: African woman with Spear
Text: Don’t be shy, baby – I’ve seen you giving me the eye. You may be weak and feeble like all men, but I like you, Daniel.

Speaker: Daniel
Text: Oh no…

Speaker: African woman with Spear
Text: Oh, I love a man who doesn’t talk back! I think if you return I may take you for my husband.

Speaker: Daniel
Text: Gulp!

Speaker: African woman with Spear
Text: Now, listen up, sugar: your bow and arrows are fine for itty bitty jobs but if you wanna pack some serious heat, you should take this spear.

Speaker: Daniel
Text: Great!
[Dan accepts the gift.]

Speaker: African woman with Spear
Text: Think of me then you throw it.
[Dan takes the Spear and leaves The Hall of Heroes.]
[Dan opens the gate with a key and enters the mysterious magic forest.]

Speaker: Book #1
Text: There used to be a Coven of Witches in the caves beneath Cemetery Hill, the whole forest’s never smelt the same since.
[Dan uses the talisman over the cauldron and calls on the Witch of the Forest.]

Speaker: Witch of the Forest
Text: Who has summoned the Witch of the Forest? Oh, it is you, Sir Fortesque. Forgive me my lord I have never met a REAL hero… Ha ha ha haa haa haaa haaaaa cackle cackle cackle!!!

Speaker: Daniel
Text: Get on with it!

Speaker: Witch of the Forest
Text: Ahem, forgive me, just an old lady’s little joke. In truth I am glad to see you Sir Fortesque: I need 7 pieces of amber that are hidden in the Ants’ nest. Bring them to me and I can grant you a special reward! I will only offer you this quest this once. Are you willing to give it a try?
[Dan accepts the quest and the witch shrinks him.]

Speaker: Witch of the Forest
Text: Sorry, didn’t I mention I’d have to shrink you to the size of an insect? Now hurry back…

Speaker: Gargoyle
Text: Run little man! If the master found it now he would crush it like a bug! Ha ha ha! Hark, we can hear the soldier ants approaching – onward and meet you tiny nemesis.
[Dan goes further and finds a small flying creature.]

Speaker: Creature
Text: Thank you for releasing me, Sir. My people wish only to live our lives in blissful harmony with nature, but alas the wicked Ant Queen has many of us imprisoned. Rescue my people, Mr. Fortesque, and you will be richly rewarded.

Speaker: Creature
Text: Here we are, I shall open the entrance for you… These fireflies are my friends; they will light your way through the darkness below.

Speaker: Book #2
Text: This magic portal was crafted by the faeries. It appears to have been created to prevent something escaping from the tunnels below.

Speaker: Book #3
Text: If you are brave enough to go beyond this point you will enter the chamber of the dreaded Queen Ant. Be aware, once you have encountered her six-legged regalness there will be no going back!
[Our hero defeats the Queen and returns to the witch. He jumps, trying to draw her attention, so she enlarges him to normal size.]

Speaker: Daniel
Text: Get on with it!

Speaker: Witch of the Forest
Text: Bless me, if it isn’t Daniel, Lord of the Ants. Hold still and I’ll remove the shrink spell…

Speaker: Witch of the Forest
Text: Ooh, lovely, lovely amber. Here you are Sir Knight, a wart covered and cabbage smelling old crone I may be but I always keep my promises: I grant you my reward!
[Dan gets Chicken Drumstick.]

Speaker: Creature
Text: You have helped to free all the fairy people from the clutches of the filthy ant scum. As a reward I can grant you passage to The Hall of Heroes. I’ve never been there myself but I’ve heard they’ve got a free bar.

Speaker: Centaur
Text: Look at you running around in your bones, Fortesque – you’re so nouveau dead.

Speaker: Daniel
Text: Get on with it!

Speaker: Centaur
Text: I Ravenhooves, last prince of the Centaurs, have not galloped the earth in over ten thousand years.

Speaker: Daniel
Text: Oh no…

Speaker: Ravenhooves The Archer
Text: Do yourself a favour, Fortesque, take my longbow – more powerful than a crossbow, the option of flaming arrows, it is truly the weapon of nobleman.
[Dan accepts the gift.]

Speaker: Daniel
Text: Yes please!

Speaker: Ravenhooves The Archer
Text: Congratulations. You don’t quite have my breeding, Mr. Johnny Come Lately, but there’s hope for you yet.
[Dan takes the Longbow and leaves The Hall of Heroes.]
[Dan enters the very village that we saw in the opening cutscene. On the way, he meets one of its inhabitants, who playing with an axe.]

Speaker: Gargoyle
Text: Poor villagers – the master possesses them. It mustn’t hurt them. Hurt guards though, they seek out an object of great power…
[Our hero walks around the village, solving puzzles and avoiding fights with the locals.]

Speaker: Book #1
Text: The rune key is held aloft by the flow of water from the fountain – you may have to wait for the next drought.

Speaker: Book #2
Text: Bust of Mr. Shanks, Landlord of the Troll’s Head. To clean the statue, lower pedestal.
[After a while, soldiers enter the village.]

Speaker: Soldier #1
Text: Hurry comrades, tear this place apart!

Speaker: Soldier #2
Text: If we don’t find the Shadow Artefact Lord Zarok will have us mucking out the demons for the next millennium!

Speaker: Book #3
Text: HISTORY OF GALLOWMERE

Speaker: Book #4
Text: HISTORY OF GALLOWMERE

Speaker: Book #5
Text: HISTORY OF GALLOWMERE

Speaker: It is said that the day would have gone to Zarok but for the skill and valour if one man
Text: Fortesque led the charge deep into the massed ranks of the undead, felling Zarok’s bodyguard, the fearful Lord Kardok, and, before finally succumbing to his own mortal wounds, slew the traitorous sorcerer with mighty sweep of his sword.

Speaker: Book #5
Text: HISTORY OF GALLOWMERE

Speaker: The forces of evil were destroyed but at a terrible price
Text: none but a handful of the King’s Militia returned from that field. Gallowmere lost a whole generation of young men that day, including Canny Tim, the legendary crossbowman and Fortesque’s second in command, who fell in the first volley of arrows.

Speaker: Book #6
Text: HEROES FROM HISTORY

Speaker: Dirk Steadfast was a fearsome opponent thanks to his magic sword and a firmly held belief that “only women defend themselves – real men are always on the attack”. He was a friend and contemporary of Karl Sturnguard and was with him to the end
Text: it was whilst Steadfast was explaining his views on Sturnquard’s shield during a feast that the latter had his tragic and inexplicable accident.

Speaker: Book #7
Text: TOURIST GUIDE TO GALLOWMERE

Speaker: Book #8
Text: TOURIST GUIDE TO GALLOWMERE

Speaker: Book #9
Text: To whom it my concern.
[In the smithy.]

Speaker: Book #10
Text: BLACKSMITH’S MONTHLY
[At the church.]

Speaker: Book #11
Text: A crucifix once stood here, but the mayor took it. Find a replacement and see how the church should really look.

Speaker: Book #12
Text: Dear Sir or Madam.
[At the exit from the level.]

Speaker: Book #13
Text: Instructions from Zarok to his guards:

Speaker: Gargoyle
Text: Back and forth like a supernatural yo yo! Maybe the Master will make it harder to find those magic egg cups!
[Dan approaches the knight with a huge shield.]

Speaker: Karl Sturnguard
Text: Ahh, Herr Fortesque – you are back on the battlefield, yah? Zis is good. People say to me “Sturnguard what do think of this sword or that axe” but I say to them “NEIN! Modern warfare is a question of science, the science of shields.”

Speaker: Daniel
Text: Get on with it!

Speaker: Karl Sturnguard
Text: I think maybe you should take my shield – yah? It is magic, Herr Fortesque. Some say it is better to have a magic sword than a magic shield but I say to you that this is rubbish!
[Dan accepts the gift.]

Speaker: Karl Sturnguard
Text: So long as you use it properly this shield will make you invincible!

Speaker: Daniel
Text: Oh no…
[Dan takes the Shield and leaves The Hall of Heroes.]
[Dan finds a vast area that looks like a park.]

Speaker: Book #1
Text: This is the garden of Zarok, nothing here is as it first seems. To leave this maze you must first seek out the one called Jack of the Green!
[Our hero encounters face, hanging on a wall.]

Speaker: Jack of the Green
Text: Greetings Sir Fortesque, my name is… Jack of the Green. I am master of riddles and this maze is my domain. You are free to leave but ONLY once you’ve answered four riddles – puzzles so fiendishly difficult, so perplexity complex that no man has ever solved them – ha, ha, ha, ha. Now try my first riddle…

Time/Location: By day they are lost without being stolen.
Text: [Dan solves the riddle and hears the voice of Jack of the Green.]

Time/Location: By day they are lost without being stolen.
Speaker: Jack of the Green
Text: Well done, Sir Knight. But my Star Riddle was but a trifle – I always like to begin with an easy one. Return hither – you will not find my next conundrum so simple!

Time/Location: By day they are lost without being stolen.
Speaker: Jack of the Green
Text: I live for laughter,

Time/Location: By day they are lost without being stolen.
Speaker: Book #2
Text: Show the Clown you care by surrounding his with smiles.

Time/Location: By day they are lost without being stolen.
Text: [Dan solves the riddle and hears the voice of Jack of the Green.]

Time/Location: By day they are lost without being stolen.
Speaker: Jack of the Green
Text: All right, yes it was a clown – very clever I’m sure. Return in haste, Sir Knight, for I wish to see the despair on your face when you hear my next cryptic puzzler.

Time/Location: By day they are lost without being stolen.
Speaker: Jack of the Green
Text: Face like a tree,
[Dan solves the riddle and hears the voice of Jack of the Green.]

Speaker: Jack of the Green
Text: Did you spot my bluff? I pretended that riddle was hard but truth it was obviously an elephant. This time, however, I almost pity you: the answer to my next vexing enigma has eluded the finest mind of a whole generation. Come to me!

Speaker: Jack of the Green
Text: I tolerate the moon and stars,
[Dan solves the riddle and hears the voice of Jack of the Green.]

Speaker: Jack of the Green
Text: Blast you! It took me ages to come up with that Darkness one! Very well, outrageous as it seems, my vast intellect has been matched by your badly decomposed brain. Return at once and I shall give you your prize.

Speaker: Jack of the Green
Text: You think you’re so clever don’t you? Here you are Sir Clever Clogs, I grant you free passage through my maze – find your own way out!
[Our hero searches the level for an exit and stumbles upon a book.]

Speaker: Book #3
Text: Solve this last puzzle and you will open the secret entrance to the asylum – the Town Mayor is imprisoned here, along with an army of madmen.
[Dan solves the puzzle with chess and leaves the level.]

Speaker: Bloodmonath Skull Cleaver
Text: Eh Mr… Fortisskay – I wanna talk with you…

Speaker: Daniel
Text: Huh… what… me?

Speaker: Bloodmonath Skull Cleaver
Text: If this Zorak so bad, why you get to go back? Why you of all people, Fortesskay?

Speaker: Daniel
Text: Oh no…

Speaker: Bloodmonath Skull Cleaver
Text: It should be I, Bloodmonath Skull Cleaver – when I lived, always I had a pile of slain strewn around me. You, you spend most of your time organizing the hanging of the guard and playing croquet with the king.

Speaker: Daniel
Text: Get on with it!

Speaker: Bloodmonath Skull Cleaver
Text: Still, I lend you my axe – you swing her, you throw her, she thirsts for slaughter as much as I.
[Dan accepts the gift.]

Speaker: Bloodmonath Skull Cleaver
Text: Drink deep of demon blood my proud beauty…
[Dan takes the Axe and leaves The Hall of Heroes.]

[Dan enters a grim mental asylum. Thunder rolls are heard. Approaching the door, he realizes that it is locked, but an idea comes into his head. He takes the worm out of his head and put it in the keyhole, and thus gets inside. After a series of trials, he finds the Mayor.]

Speaker: The Town Mayor
Text: By ‘eck, am I glad to see you! That Zarok tried to force me to hand over the Shadow Artefact - he means to release the Demons from their tomb under the Enchanted Forest.

Speaker: Daniel
Text: Tell me about it!

Speaker: The Town Mayor
Text: Right, well I’ll see myself out, thanks. You have a good look around, lad, Zarok’s left some stuff lying about that I think you might find useful.

Speaker: Daniel
Text: Great!
[Dan takes the Artefact and leaves the level.]

Speaker: Ravenhooves The Archer
Text: Oh, Daniel - I’ve got something here I can give you but I’ve no idea what it is. Do you fancy a little gamble, like?
[Dan accepts the gift. It’s Flaming Longbow. After taking it he leaves The Hall of Heroes.]
[Exploration of the Enchanted Forest continues.]

Speaker: Book #2
Text: Like a giant Magpie the Dragon Bird sits upon its hoard of stolen treasures. High above the trees you will find a nest; those Eggs are worth their weight in gold!

Speaker: Book #3
Text: Keep out! This gate leads to the tomb of the Shadow Demons.
[Day approaches the cave in which Shadow Demons are imprisoned.]

Speaker: Gargoyle
Text: None shall enter. The Shadow Demons are entombed within, separated from the world of goodness and light until the earth cracks open. No one, not even the dark lord Zarok, can release them without the Shadow Artefact. Leave now or share their doom.
[Inside the cave.]

Speaker: Book #4
Text: Sir Dan you must take the Shadow Demon Talisman! It is an unholy relic but it may allow you to progress through the Shadow Demon territory.
[Our hero releases Shadow Demons and takes Shadow Talisman.]

Speaker: Gargoyle
Text: What have you done? Once again the Shadow Demons are wreaking havoc across the land - and it's all thanks to you! The single most destructive and wretched creatures in the history of the world and you've given them an early parole. They will be heading for the ruins of King Peregrin's Castle - Gallowmere is doomed!
[Fighting with Shadow Demons and defeating the boss - a few small dragons, our hero leaves the Enchanted Forest.]

Speaker: Bloodmonath Skull Cleaver
Text: Ten thousand curses, Fortisskay, I bet money you be back pushing up daisies by now! Hey, I have something here for you. You like it very much. You want?
[Dan accepts the gift. Its 3 chests of gold. After taking it he leaves The Hall of Heroes.]
[We see an old gloomy battlefield, littered with corpses, banners and weapons. From the huge puddle crawls out the unquiet dead.]

Speaker: Gargoyle
Text: Cold and dark and reeking of death. We remembers an ancient battle fought here, between the forces of good and the dark armies of Zarok! Now the marshes are full of the restless dead.

Speaker: Book #1
Text: Weapons are useless against the heavy armor of the knights. Don't let them shove you in the swamp - that mud will never come out.

Speaker: Boat Man
Text: Greetings stranger, I am the Boat Man - it is I who ferry lost souls on their final journey to the Land of the Dead. But hold, have we not met before? Sir Daniel Fortesque! Not you too? Thanks to Zarok's meddlings I'm up to my eye sockets in lost souls who've woken from the eternal sleep - business hasn't been this brisk since before they invented sanitation.
[Dan collects 8 helmets and goes to the Boat Man.]

Speaker: Boat Man
Text: How gracious of you! Makes a change to meet a polite young skeleton after dealing with those filthy zombie types! Hop aboard.
[Dan jumps into the boat and sails with the Boat Man. The level ends.]

Speaker: Dirk Steadfast
Text: Alright, Dan man, how ya doing?

Speaker: Daniel
Text: Not too good!

Speaker: Dirk Steadfast
Text: Now then, have ya got yourself a magic sword?

Speaker: Daniel
Text: No I do not!

Speaker: Dirk Steadfast
Text: What? Daniel, man, you cannot go into battle against an army of undead without a magic sword… Here take mine, you’ll never have to sharpen another blade or my name not Dirk Steadfast. it’s not enough just to have a magic shield, you know, no matter what that soft, thickie Sturnguard says.

Speaker: Daniel
Text: Great!
[Dan accepts the gift.]

Speaker: Dirk Steadfast
Text: Good lad. I’d sooner go into battle holding a tea tray than carry that weedy girl’s shield of his!
[The Boat Man takes Dan across the lake.]

Speaker: Book #1
Text: You haven't got your army now - better to use stealth than charge in. Beware the watchers - if they spot you they will soon summon others.

Speaker: Book #2
Text: The Crystal contraptions that surround the whirlpool can freeze its dangerously turbulent waters. You will need all of the Rune keys to activate the magical machines.
[Dan activates 3 weird looking machines around the whirlpool, freezes it and jump straight in.]

Speaker: Book #3
Text: Zarok's magic has caused the once lost, mythical town of Mellowmede to rise from its watery grave!
[At the exit, Dan sees a gargoyle.]

Speaker: Gargoyle
Text: The ancient people of this long vanished town once sought to harness the power of Crystals found in the caverns below. Now Zarok seeks to unlock the secrets of this arcane science. This mine shaft leads deep into the earth, to certain doom in the Crystal Caverns.

Speaker: Ravenhooves The Archer
Text: Oh, Daniel - I’ve got something here I can give you but I’ve no idea what it is. Do you fancy a little gamble, like?
[Dan accepts the gift. Its Magic Longbow. After taking it he leaves The Hall of Heroes.]
[Dan enters the cave with many thick crystalline pillars, connected by small bridges. He speaks with a gargoyle.]

Speaker: Gargoyle
Text: The ancient town of Mellowmede was destroyed by creatures known as Rhinotaurs. They live on still but in a state of hibernation deep within these Caverns, they use the Crystals to prolong their worthless hides.

Speaker: Book #1
Text: Tread softly in these caves for an ill tempered Dragon has a lair here.
[In the dragon's cave.]

Speaker: Book #2
Text: The mean old Dragon can be summoned by inserting two Dragon Gems into the eye sockets of the relief. The grouchy Dragon doesn't come out much as he is afraid of the roof collapsing over his head!
[Dan uses two Dragon Gems in front of a carved picture of Dragon’s head.]

Speaker: Dragon
Text: Who dares to enter my lair and wake me from my slumber? Aha! Prepare yourself, little man, I shall roast the flesh from your bones...  Oh, um... I see... In that case... I will pluck out both of your eyes…  ah… oh, great... I'm... I'm just going to give you a good hiding!
Action: (sees that Dan is a skeleton) (notices that Dan has only one eye)

Text: [After Dragon’s inevitable defeat.]

Speaker: Dragon
Text: Urghh... Enough... I yield! That really hurt. What did you have to go and do that for? Here, take this Dragon Potion and leave me alone! Drink it when you need it - it gives you armour that is impervious to heat, plus it lets you breathe fire. Now go away!
[Dan takes the potion and leaves the crystalline cave.]

Speaker: Gargoyle
Text: Wouldn't this make a wonderful tourist attraction! Come see Sturnguard the mighty! Come see the last of the Centaurs! Oh and see that dork over there, that's Daniel Fortesque 'would be hero'! Ha ha ha!
[The gate on the second floor is finally open. Behind them Dan finds the statue of Megwynne Stormbinder.]

Speaker: Megwynne Stormbinder
Text: Daniel, there you are! I was so worried about you.

Speaker: Daniel
Text: You were!?

Speaker: Megwynne Stormbinder
Text: I know you have the heart of a hero, Daniel, now we must show the others. Would you like to take my magic lightning bolts - I don't have many but they're very powerful.
[Dan accepts the gift.]

Speaker: Daniel
Text: Yes please!

Speaker: Megwynne Stormbinder
Text: Off you pop then and keep your chin up!

Speaker: Daniel
Text: Watch it!

Speaker: Megwynne Stormbinder
Text: Oops, sorry Daniel. Now take care, the good people of Gallowmere are depending on you.
[Dan takes the Lightning and leaves The Hall of Heroes.]
[Dan finds some ruins, teeming with dead men and hangmen.]

Speaker: Book #1
Text: Take care not to wake the Serpent of Gallowmere. It is a most powerful supernatural creature that was bound somewhere withing these chasm walls. If you encounter it, RUN!

Speaker: Book #2
Text: The fabled Dragon Armor was forged by Dragons from an age long ago. Seek out any remaining Dragons if you are to claim this mighty armor.

Speaker: Book #3
Text: Unable to pass through the fiery Dragon Gate? Only use this alternative route if no other is available and return to the map of Gallowmere.
[Near the huge burning gate.]

Speaker: Book #4
Text: This magical barrier was constructed by the Dragons of old. Only those brave enough to adorn the Dragon Armor may pass through this fiery gate way.
[Dan uses Dragon Armor and pass through. He encounters the Serpent of Gallowmere and frees it. After that he leaves the level.]

Speaker: Ravenhooves The Archer
Text: Oh, Daniel - I’ve got something here I can give you but I’ve no idea what it is. Do you fancy a little gamble, like?
[Dan accepts the gift. It’s Life Bottle.]
[Dan approaches the shadow fortress captured by the Shadow Demons.]

Speaker: Book #1
Text: Since the Farmers have been captured by the Shadow Demons the animals here have gone hungry.
[Getting inside the fortress, he talks to a gargoyle.]

Speaker: Gargoyle
Text: Welcome to Castle Peregrin. In the time of King Peregrin this magnificent edifice was the seat of power and home to the royal household. Now it is home only to ghosts and forgotten memories.

Speaker: Book #2
Text: The Farmers are being held in the courtyard. At the first sign of trouble the Shadow Demons will sacrifice the captives to the flames. Move quickly, slay the demons on guard and release the farmers.
[Dan releases the captives and explores the castle, then speaks with another gargoyle.]

Speaker: Gargoyle
Text: Sir Daniel Fortesque, it's been a long time. Welcome back to your home. But it is sad that you should see it so - the jewel in Gallowmere's crown has become a corrupt haven for Zarok's Army of Shadow Demons!

Speaker: Book #3
Text: Long ago this was once the majestic Throne room of King Peregrin. Now foul demons stalk the corridors. The spirit of the King must be saddened indeed.

Speaker: Book #4
Text: Sometimes the ghost of King Peregrin can be seen wandering these halls or sitting mournfully upon his throne. Find his crown and perhaps you can summon him.

Speaker: Book #5
Text: The castle was constructed on top of a dormant volcano. This great flood gate is all that stands between you and a very hot shower.
[Our hero finds the crown of King Peregrin and calls his spirit.]

Speaker: King Peregrin
Text: Sir Fortesque, noblest of my courtiers, bravest of my captains! Oh that we should meet at such a dark hour, with the fate of this realm lying once again in your hands. Good god,Fortesque - what's happened to your jaw?

Speaker: Daniel
Text: Fell off!

Speaker: King Peregrin
Text: Bad luck old man. Now look, Zarok's army of Shadow Demons hide beneath us within this very mountain, they prepare as we speak to invade fair Gallowmere. If we are to thwart his plans we must bring down the castle on top of them, we must unleash the lava behind the floodgates! I can take you to the gate's control lever, but you alone can pull it.

Speaker: Daniel
Text: Huh… what… me?

Speaker: King Peregrin
Text: Of course it's a highly dangerous mission - even for a dead man. I dare say that when that fiend sees what you've done he'll make sure you spend eternity in the most unspeakable torment. But then I know these things mean nothing to a man of your iron will, eh Fortesque?

Speaker: Daniel
Text: Gulp!

Speaker: King Peregrin
Text: Splendid! Good luck old friend!
[King Peregrin teleports Dan to the battlefield.]

Speaker: Gargoyle's Voice
Text: The lava has been released Sir Dan, the Castle is collapsing! You will not have long to defeat the stone Golems and escape the ensuing inferno!
[Dan defeated the Golems and continues to explore the castle.]

Speaker: Book #6
Text: Hot scalding Oil! Burn your skeletal toes that will! Better find a way to close the oil vents before crossing.

Speaker: Book #7
Text: Hurry - the castle is about to be destroyed! The gates are locked, find an alternative means of travel!
[Our hero crushing the wall with a catapult and sits to the place of the projectile. He catapults himself out of the Castle Peregrin.]

Speaker: Imanzi Shongama
Text: Well hello stranger. I've got a little present for you - why don't you shut your eye and hold out your hands?
[Dan accepts the gift. It’s 2 Energy Vials.]

[Dan lands before some kind of Stonehenge where he is immediately attacked by chicken like dinosaur. Fleeing from it, our hero runs up to the edge of the rock from where it takes away a huge hawk, and the dinosaur comically falls into the abyss. The hawk takes Dan to the Ghost Ship.]

Speaker: First Mate
Text: Captain, I thought you ought to know we have a stowaway on board, I've told the men to scour the decks for him.

Speaker: Captain
Text: Good, I want that scurvy dog dangling from yon yardarm by his bowels!

Speaker: First Mate
Text: Is that really necessary? Couldn't we just give him a good tongue lashing and drop him off at the next port?

Speaker: Captain
Text: Look, there's not a man jack on this ship who wouldn't keelhaul his own grandmother for the silver in her hair - there'll be no tongue lashing! Bring the landlubber to me an' I'll tear 'im a new orifice!
[Dan starts to explore the Ghost Ship.]

Speaker: Book #1
Text: Most of the crew seem to be under the control of a few officers - without them they'd be like headless chickens...

Speaker: Book #2
Text: The Ghost Ship Captain is as tough as old sea boots! You will need something a little more powerful than the weapons in your inventory to knock him overboard!
[Our hero defeats the Captain and takes control of the Ship in his own fleshless hands. The level ends.]

Speaker: Karl Sturnguard
Text: You are back, Herr Fortesque, I think this is because of my shield, yah? But I have something else I can give to you, something you may find verrrry interesting.
[Dan accepts the gift. It’s 4 chests of gold.]
[The Ghost Ship takes our hero to the castle of Zarok.]

Speaker: Gargoyle
Text: Sir Daniel Fortesque! Standing bold as you like in the foyer of Zarok's castle - who'd have thought it. Not us that's for sure. We's afraid the Master of the House is out trying to plunge the land into eternal night, but come on in and make yourself at home!

Speaker: Book #1
Text: Those mischievous Imps have been at Zarok's spell books again. They're shielded by magic, the naughty creatures!
[Dan descends into Zarok's private quarters.]

Speaker: Book #2
Text: The Secret Diary of Zarok

Speaker: 100 years I've spent in exile, using my anger to keep me warm, feeding off my suffering, relaxing with my angst. But soon they will pay, all of them - including Fortesque. He thwarts my first plan to conquer Gallowmere and then posthumously claims to have killed me! When I find him I'm going to get medieval on his bony behind. I never liked him anyway, always hanging around the court, interfering
Text: “Where are you going with that dead cat, Zarok”, “Where did you find that brain, Zarok?”. Wretched busybody.

Speaker: Book #3
Text: SPELL BOOK

Time/Location: Looking good for the over 400s - pg136
Speaker: Dirk Steadfast
Text: Eh Dan man, how's that sword bearing up? I told you it was magic, reet? I’ve got something here I can give you but I've no idea what it is. D'ya fancy your chances, like?

Time/Location: Looking good for the over 400s - pg136
Text: [Dan accepts the gift. It’s Life Bottle. After taking it he leaves the level.]

Time/Location: Looking good for the over 400s - pg136
Text: [Finding a mechanism in Zarok's castle, Dan pulls the handle and falls through a long tunnel to the clock themed underground city.]

Time/Location: Looking good for the over 400s - pg136
Speaker: Gargoyle
Text: Using a dark magic called 'science' Zarok has constructed a device based around the mechanical measurement of time. The innards of this chronograph are fiendishly complicated. Keep your eye on the flying timepieces and get ready to reset the hands of the master time clock.

Time/Location: Looking good for the over 400s - pg136
Text: [Dan explores the city, solving various ingenious puzzles.]

Time/Location: Looking good for the over 400s - pg136
Speaker: Book #1
Text: This metal keep houses the magical chariot that Zarok calls his Train. The path it runs along leads eventually to Zarok's Lair, however your route is blocked by gates controlled at various way stations. Travel to these on the Train, open the gates and head for the Lair.

Time/Location: Looking good for the over 400s - pg136
Text: [Dan continues to explore the city by train. He goes from station to station, collecting the keys until he finds the exit.]

Time/Location: Looking good for the over 400s - pg136
Speaker: Gargoyle
Text: You prove us all wrong! Maybe it is destined to be a Hero, maybe it can defeat Zarok! The people of Gallowmere may never know of your past mistakes and you will indeed be remembered as the peoples hero! Your time in exile is over, welcome to your new home Sir Daniel Fortesque!

Time/Location: Looking good for the over 400s - pg136
Speaker: Megwynne Stormbinder
Text: Daniel, thank goodness you're still safe. I have a gift I can give to you but sadly I cannot say how useful you will find it.

Time/Location: Looking good for the over 400s - pg136
Text: [Dan accepts the gift. Its 3 Energy Vials. He takes it and leaves the level.]

Time/Location: Looking good for the over 400s - pg136
Text: [Dan drives up to Zarok's Lair on the train.]

Time/Location: Looking good for the over 400s - pg136
Speaker: Gargoyle
Text: We never thought you'd get this far - your final encounter with Zarok awaits beyond this point. He has surrounded himself with his unnatural bodyguards - but you may yet even the odds by calling upon the lost Souls collected within your Chalice. Place the Chalice on the Shield at the heart of the arena. Good luck Sir Daniel Fortesque.

Time/Location: Looking good for the over 400s - pg136
Text: [Having bought some supplies before the final battle our hero enters the lair of his sworn enemy without hesitation.]

Time/Location: Looking good for the over 400s - pg136
Speaker: Zarok
Text: Sir Fortesque, my old nemesis, so we meet again! I see that a century spent as worm food has done nothing to diminish your naive obsession with the freedom of Gallowmere.

Time/Location: Looking good for the over 400s - pg136
Text: [An army of skeletons appears.]

Time/Location: Looking good for the over 400s - pg136
Speaker: Zarok
Text: Prepare to attack, my warriors, I want the dogs gnawing marrow from those bones within the hour… Aargh! What is that Fortesque, your lucky cup?

Time/Location: Looking good for the over 400s - pg136
Text: [From the Chalice in the center of the arena flies out the souls, turning into skeleton warriors, the army of Sir Daniel. Dan uses the lighting to heal the warriors in exchange for his own health.]

Time/Location: Looking good for the over 400s - pg136
Speaker: Sir Daniel Knights
Text: For the honour of Gallowmere!

Time/Location: Looking good for the over 400s - pg136
Text: [After battle.]

Time/Location: Looking good for the over 400s - pg136
Speaker: Message
Text: The battle is over…

Time/Location: Looking good for the over 400s - pg136
Speaker: Sir Daniel Knights
Text: This battle is ours. We are free from the tyranny of Zarok!

Time/Location: Looking good for the over 400s - pg136
Text: [The army of Sir Daniel disappears.]

Time/Location: Looking good for the over 400s - pg136
Speaker: Zarok
Text: You always were fortunate in battle, Fortesque. Let us see how you fare against my champion, the late Lord Kardok. He eats people like you as calcium supplement!

Time/Location: Looking good for the over 400s - pg136
Text: [Dan defeat Lord Kardok.]

Time/Location: Looking good for the over 400s - pg136
Speaker: Zarok
Text: Bugger! Right then, that's it! I've just about had enough of your meddling!  Where is that spell? Ah yes!  No! Not that spell! Oooh...  Oh not right now! Ha ha! Now I have it!  None shall defeat the mighty Zarok! So prepare to die Fortesque!
Action: (he goes behind the curtains) (funny animal sounds) (more funny animal sounds) (Zarok comes out of the gates of the arena in the form of a clown-like dinosaur.)

Time/Location: Looking good for the over 400s - pg136
Text: [The final battle begins. After his defeat, Zarok’s dinosaur-clown explodes to pieces showing us the sorcerer himself. He is greatly weakened and barely keeps on his feet.]

Time/Location: Looking good for the over 400s - pg136
Speaker: Zarok
Text: Ughhh - Curse you Sir Knight. I am finally defeated. Yet if I am to fail then all shall perish! You are doomed Fortesque! You will never leave this domain! Ha ha ha!

Time/Location: Looking good for the over 400s - pg136
Text: [He tries to use magic to destroy everything around, but the first fragment smears him on the floor. Dan manages to escape from the collapsing Castle of Zarok, but he again picked up by a vulture. Flying over Gallowmere, our hero sees how souls abducted by Zarok return to the inhabitants of the Sleeping Village. The vulture takes Dan to his Crypt there he finally can rest.]

Time/Location: Looking good for the over 400s - pg136
Text: [If you collect all the Chalice in the game you can see the additional scene. Dan returns to The Hall of Heroes there everyone is laughing, feasting and singing. Seeing Dan music stops and everyone looks at him. He does a few flips on the table, grabs a goblet with wine and immediately drinks it. All the heroes in the hall applaud him. In the starry sky lights up a new star named after our hero.]
